page.title: 06STRATHTYRUM ESTATE
page.content: The farm land to the West of the town is part of the Strathtyrum Estate. It has been the property of the Cheape family since 1780 and the present owner is Mrs Cheape, a widow without children. Strathtyrum House was built in the 18th Century and has a very impressive frontage added by Robert Balfour in the early 19th century. There is a 17th century doocot in the grounds and a family mausoleum. Balgove and Strathtyrum Farms are managed by a Chartered Surveyor, D.Reid of Cupar and the farm houses are let. The land is used for grazing both sheep and cattle and for a range of arable crops. This year, as an experiment, 2 fields on Balgove Farm have been set aside to grow wheat and oats by organic methods. The owners of Strathtyrum retain the right to dig for shells on the Old Course.
